bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Requesting an update for xfce4-whiskermenu-plugin.
Now there are two releases.
One that still depends on GTK 2 (1.6.0)
and
One that now depends on GTK 3 (2.0.0)
I would say: Go for the GTK 3 version because we already depend on a mixture of GTK 2 and GTK 3 based xfce plugins. So better now with GTK 3 than later.
Request for Fedora 24 and upwards.
yes. i'm just back from break. i'll build it soon ...
*** Bug 1370855 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

unfortunately, i cannot build 2.0.0 at the moment since I have to update exo first.
So, 1.6.0 it is. Building right now.

(In reply to Mukundan Ragavan from comment #3) > So, 1.6.0 it is. Building right now.
Thanks!
> unfortunately, i cannot build 2.0.0 at the moment since I have to update exo > first.
The new exo (or the update) won't change anything for the existing xfce 4.12 users. From my own investigations the new exo provides the following libraries:
libexo-1.so.0 libexo-1.so.0.1.0 libexo-2.so.0 libexo-2.so.0.1.0
libexo-1 for the GTK2 stuff libexo-2 for the GTK3 stuff
... while the old exo only offers libexo-1. So even if you might consider updating exo within the official Fedora repos, people may not notice any changes or differences at all.

xfce4-whiskermenu-plugin-1.6.0-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-59b122a381

(In reply to Ali Akcaagac from comment #4)
> > unfortunately, i cannot build 2.0.0 at the moment since I have to update exo > > first. > > The new exo (or the update) won't change anything for the existing xfce 4.12 > users. From my own investigations the new exo provides the following > libraries: > > libexo-1.so.0 > libexo-1.so.0.1.0 > libexo-2.so.0 > libexo-2.so.0.1.0 > > libexo-1 for the GTK2 stuff > libexo-2 for the GTK3 stuff > > ... while the old exo only offers libexo-1. So even if you might consider > updating exo within the official Fedora repos, people may not notice any > changes or differences at all.
I agree but I would much prefer to update core components as part of xfce 4.14 update ... if at all possible.

See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-b459b22b3e
